title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area: Getting Around
body: Getting Around       Between the Lake of the Arbuckles and the Platt Historic District, the park covers nearly 10,000 acres. Here are a couple things to keep in mind when traveling through the park.        Going over the Sycamore Crossing NPS/Chickasaw National Recreation Area  Water Crossings Three low water crossings are an integral part of the road system in the Platt Historic District. West of Highway 177 are two crossings where the perimeter road passes over Rock Creek. These crossings are usually above the water level. East of Highway 177 the Perimeter Road crosses Travertine Creek at the Sycamore Crossing. This crossing is usually covered in several inches of water; motorcyclists are encouraged to use the southeast perimeter road as alternate access for Little Niagara and the Travertine Nature Center. During periods of high water it is possible that one or more of these crossings may be closed.      Many Entrances, many Exits Over a dozen entry points provide access into all of the different areas of the park; this can be confusing to first time visitors. A park map may help you gain a better understanding of how to get to where you want to be.
